text:
Hello team, I'm Florian from Rently.
It's nice to see that mobile is getting support for chat.
How to set the name and email  in the Mobile SDK so that the customer service backend can see the chatter's name
Where can I see the custom parameters passed by Mobile SDK in the customer service backend?
We need to display the name. Does Mobile SDK have relevant API?
My project supports at least 13.0, but the minimum Mobile SDK is 15.0. How can I import without errors? I have tried #if canImport but it doesn't work.

Hello!
> We need to display the name. Does Mobile SDK have relevant API?
If the visitor is an existing contact, you can use (or set up) <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversation/visitor-identification|visitor identification> before beginning the chat. Otherwise, you would need to prompt for the visitor's name using bots.

> My project supports at least 13.0, but the minimum Mobile SDK is 15.0. How can I import without errors? I have tried #if canImport but it doesn't work.
CC <@U07A2SN2X4K> - would you be able to answer this question?

> Where can I see the custom parameters passed by Mobile SDK in the customer service backend?
CC <@U06GS7BG27J> - do you know this offhand or can pull in BE to answer?

<@U07ARLLF39N> Not possible. Minimum supported version is iOS 15, iOS 13 isn't supported. I'm not aware of any solution that would allow importing it. It's a choice between not adding the sdk and continuing supporting iOS 13, or dropping support for iOS 13 and gaining the ability for adding the SDK.
